page.title: 04What Farmers Do in Boughton
page.content: Most farms in our block survive by growing a wide variety of crops.This means many duties are required.In the hop fields you can see Mr. Lyons on his stilts,or using a long pole,to tie up the strings to the wires for the hops to grow up. Some farmers do lots of spraying.In Spring they spray the young buds to protect them against mildew and aphids.Later they spray them to keep the fruit on the trees until they are ready for picking.In winter they spray to kill any over-wintering pests.This has caused some of us at school to get sore throats. Lots of mums go picking in summer to get some holiday money.Some farmers don't hire pickers,instead they have "Pick-Your Own" signs.People come and pick what they want,then have it weighed and priced as they go out.
